name: Cashmere Cat
description:
'''Magnus August HÃ¸iberg''' (born 29 November 1987), known professionally as '''Cashmere Cat''', is a Norwegian DJ and record producer. Often in tandem with [[Benny Blanco]], he has been credited with production work for artists including [[Kanye West]], [[BTS]], [[Snoop Dogg]], [[the Kid Laroi]], [[Selena Gomez]], [[Camila Cabello]], [[Ariana Grande]], [[Tory Lanez]], [[Major Lazer]], [[the Weeknd]], [[Kali Uchis]] and [[Lil Uzi Vert]], His debut studio album, ''[[9 (Cashmere Cat album)|9]]'' (2017) was released by blanco's Mad Love Records, an imprint of [[Interscope Records]] and peaked at number 14 on the [[VG-lista]] charts. It also entered the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and included the single "[[Adore (Cashmere Cat song)|Adore]]" (featuring [[Ariana Grande]]), which marked his only entry on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].

His debut extended play (EP), ''[[Mirror Maru]]'' (2012) was met with widespread critical praise. His second album, ''[[Princess Catgirl]]'' (2019) followed thereafter and experimented with [[hyperpop]].
